page.title: 05THE FORGE
page.content: Rodmarton forge has been on the edge of the village for 4 years. Its 2 workshops are carpentry & metalwork. The latter has 3 forges.These contain a lot of coal lit by a blow torch fuelled by bottle gas. A fan is used to make the fire burn well.Steel is put in the fire and when pliable it is beaten into shape on an anvil.The blacksmith is a farrier but no longer shoes horses. His main work is mending farm machinery. In the carpentry shop gates,hurdles,stable doors and posts are made. Special orders such as rabbit hutches and dog kennels are fulfilled. Most of the wood used is imported soft wood treated with preservative.Wire,twine,saws, hammers and other items used on farms are sold.The owner sells feeding troughs with adjusable legs which he designed. 8 people work at the forge.
